Description: Rim sherd (mended from two, with 1924,1202.425) of Chian Mature Animal Style pottery heavy chalice; white slip; interior: reserved band at rim, glazed streaky black below; part of lotus flower and rosette in added white outline with added red centres; below, two white bands; top of lip glazed; exterior: band of short vertical strokes at rim; below, key maeander between bands; painted decoration consisting of goat (rump and tail remaining) to right; elaborate rosettes, pendant triangle and vertical strokes as filling ornament.
Curator's comments: Lemos describes the sherd as coming from a light-walled and big chalice belonging to the Group of Elaborate Animal Chalices. Chalices that fall into this group are usually large and heavy-walled and are also known as chalice-kraters. Chalices in this group display elaborate compositions that include polychromy and delicately painted figures (Lemos 1991, 90-1). The sherd joins British Museum 1924,1201.425.
Bibliographic references: Lemos 1991 / Archaic Pottery of Chios. The Decorated Styles (p. 90, p. 122, p. 257, no. 471, pl. 64)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.1543) (phase 2)
